meanings.definition: To pack or carry in a knapsack.
meanings.sent1: She knapsacked her lunch before heading out for a hike.
meanings.sent2: He knapsacked all his essentials for the camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel knapsacked nuts for the winter in its tiny bag.
meanings.sent4: The student knapsacked knowledge from books into his mind.
meanings.sent5: They knapsacked memories of their adventure in their hearts.

meanings.sent1: The old knapsacked held treasures from his travels.
meanings.sent2: She found an antique knapsacked in the attic.
meanings.sent3: The knapsacked was dusty but full of surprises.
meanings.sent4: His knapsacked was a time capsule of past adventures.
meanings.sent5: The worn knapsacked told stories of distant lands.
